    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    This method sets up the Customer screen to be populated with all customers (see populateCustomersTable).

    This method takes users to the Add Customers screen when the Add button is clicked.

    This method takes users to the Appointments screen when the Appointments button is clicked.
    void
    onDelete()
    This method handles deletion of a customer when a customer is selected and the Delete button is selected.
    void
    onLogoutClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method redirects the user to the Login screen, as well as clearing the current user object (to be reset on next login) when the Logout button is clicked.
    void
    onModifyClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method takes users to the Modify Customer screen when a customer is selected and the Modify button is clicked.
    void
    populateCustomersTable()
    This method populates the Customers table with all customers (Create Date and Last Updated are only displayed as Strings for formatting purposes, the objects themselves use LocalDateTime and are stored as such)

    • onAddClick

      public void onAddClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method takes users to the Add Customers screen when the Add button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onModifyClick

      public void onModifyClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method takes users to the Modify Customer screen when a customer is selected and the Modify button is clicked. Customer data will be populated on the form. If there isn't a customer selected they will see an alert prompting them to select one.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onDelete

      public void onDelete() throws SQLException
      This method handles deletion of a customer when a customer is selected and the Delete button is selected. If a customer is not selected they will be prompted to select one. When a customer is selected they will be prompted to confirm the deletion. An alert modal is also given to confirm the customer was successfully deleted or not.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onAppointmentClick

      public void onAppointmentClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method takes users to the Appointments screen when the Appointments button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onLogoutClick

      public void onLogoutClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method redirects the user to the Login screen, as well as clearing the current user object (to be reset on next login) when the Logout button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • populateCustomersTable

      public void populateCustomersTable() throws SQLException
      This method populates the Customers table with all customers (Create Date and Last Updated are only displayed as Strings for formatting purposes, the objects themselves use LocalDateTime and are stored as such)
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method sets up the Customer screen to be populated with all customers (see populateCustomersTable).
